page.title: 18Flora and Fauna
page.content: Much of the area is forested;{pine, {larch and spruce.}Deciduous trees include{oak,beech,ash,sycamore and {elder. In spring{snowdrops,cowslips, {bluebells,primroses,wild daffodils, {oxslips}and{wood anemones are amongst the wild flowers most noticed. Later in the year{buttercups,kingcups, wild {garlic,red campion,wild strawberries {and red and white comfrey}are seen in profusion. There are{fallow deer}in the Miserden Park and evidence of{badgers, {foxes,rabbits,hares,squirrels,stoats, {rats,voles,wood mice,hedgehogs,shrews and{bats}can be seen.{Grass snakes}and {adders}are numerous. The hundreds of{pheasants}are obvious.Less so are{buzzards,herons, {chaffinches,goldfinches,}various{owls, {house martins}and{grey wagtails.
